newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Santos shares sparked by Goyder gas find.
newsitem.headline: Santos shares sparked by Goyder gas find.

text.p: Shares in major petroleum producer Santos Ltd climbed 11 cents to A$5.34 on Thursday, their highest level since October 1987, following Wednesday's announcement of a new gas field in the Cooper/Eromanga basin of onshore South Australia.

Santos said the Goyder 2 exploration well located on the south eastern flank of the Allunga trough had flowed gas at 154,300 cubic metres per day and condensate at 43 cubic metres or 477 barrels per day.
A second drill stem test conducted over a 28 metre interval had flowed gas at 159,400 cubic metres per day and condensate at 76 cubic metres per day.
"There has been some interest in the stock after that report yesterday," said a Sydney-based broker, although he noted that the rise was gradual rather than meteoric.
"It's not roaring ahead and the volumes have not been spectacular."
Santos shares closed nine cents higher at A$5.32 on turnover of 1.4 million.
